items.to_string:
As an infra engineer, I need to rework the BIP AI Gateway Helm chart to reflect the updated plan and prepare for the transition to the MGMT cluster. 

A/C:
- The gateway Helm chart is updated based on the new plan outlined in BIP-29065

Value Statement:
As a BIP-AI engineer who monitors tenant Bedrock usage, I need the ability to view Bedrock inference request metrics on the Grafana MLOps dashboard so that I can identify usage trends across all tenants and detect potential service quota limitations.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When tenants generate Bedrock inference requests, the updated Grafana MLOps dashboard displays the relevant request metrics.
- Dashboard panels are added or updated to show Bedrock inference request counts for all tenants, including appropriate filtering and aggregation.
- Manual tests validate that the metrics populate correctly and update in near real time.

items.to_string:
Title: Create Grafana Alerts for Bedrock Resource counts

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI engineer who monitors tenant Bedrock usage, I need the ability to notified on Bedrock resource counts so that I can proactively increase quota limits for future resource provisioning for our tenants

Acceptance Criteria:
 * When high level resources reach 80% of service quota limit, an alert is triggered
 * - Alerts are connected to MLOps dashboard panel
 * - Alerts are routed to nonprod Slack channel
 * - Manual tests to force "firing" are done to validate the alert logic and setup

Value Statement
As a BIP AI infra engineer who design gateway app, I need the ability to add audit logs on the gateway api so that tenant user's additional gateway app functionalities can be logged and traced to that particular user.

Acceptance Criteria

1 Add well formatted audit logs to each and every mlops api.
2 Relevant Logs can be filtered and displayed in Grafana dashboard.
This issue is cloned by BIP-29190

AC: Jenkins pipeline is able to update EVA's Bedrock Agents

AC: Jenkins pipeline is able to update and ingest to EVA's knowledge base

items.from_string: Add Additional High Level Bedrock Metrics to MLOPS Dashboard
items.to_string: Create alerts for Lambda metrics for MLOps team

items.from_string:
Title: Create alerts for Lambda metrics for MLOps team

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who manages Grafana alerting, I need the ability to create a Grafana alert when tenant lambda metrics are collected so that we are able to monitor and ensure that the lambdas are preforming as expected.

Acceptance Criteria: - Identify the tenants that are using lambdas - Create alerts for when tenant lambdas fail. - Create alerts on reaching lambda quotas - Identify other potential metrics/alerts - Update MLOps dashboard documentation in confluence
items.to_string:
Title: Add High-Level Bedrock Metrics to MLOps Dashboard

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who monitors Bedrock-driven services, I need the ability to display additional high-level Bedrock metrics on the MLOps Dashboard so that I can better understand platform usage, detect anomalies, and support operational decision-making.

Acceptance Criteria:

-When an MLOps engineer views the MLOps Dashboard, the user has the ability to see updated high-level

-Bedrock metrics (e.g., knowledge bases, inference profiles, automation blueprints, and agents).

-Metrics are collected and published automatically at a defined interval and displayed in Grafana.

-Dashboard panels and alerting rules are added for each metric type.

-Documentation and automated tests are updated to cover metric collection and visualization.

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who manages Grafana alerting, I need the ability to create a Grafana alert when tenant lambda metrics are collected so that we are able to monitor and ensure that the lambdas are preforming as expected.

items.to_string:
Title:
Enable logging for Bedrock resource count

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who adds Bedrock resources that trigger a Lambda to list resources, I need the ability to enable logging of Bedrock resource counts into CloudWatch Metrics so that I can reliably track service quota limits.Acceptance Criteria:
- When a user adds, updates, or removes a Bedrock resource (triggering the listing Lambda), the user has the ability to see the updated Bedrock resource count in CloudWatch Metrics.
- The Lambda publishes a CloudWatch metric as a trigger to adding additional resources returned and dimensions
- Metrics are visible in the AWS CloudWatch Metrics
- Minimum resources include: knowledge bases, inference profile, blueprints, agents

Title: Deployment of a Strands agent in K8 Value Statement: As a BIP‑AI MLOps Engineer, I need a full‑featured RAF-Strands deployed in Kubernetes so I can demonstrate the deployment pattern of deployment and how to query it.

AC: Basic strands agent deployed in dev, along with proper helm charts, dockerfile, image builder process, and notebook in tenant-resources demonstrating how to query it.

Title: Evaluate Langfuse and OpenTelemetry Integration Options for AWS Bedrock Observability

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer who maintains observability for generative AI workloads, I need the ability to evaluate and plan how Langfuse and OpenTelemetry can be integrated with AWS Bedrock services (including agents, knowledge bases, and related components) so that we can establish a standardized, extensible observability framework for tracing, metrics, and performance monitoring across tenant use cases.

Acceptance Criteria: -When the evaluation is complete, the engineer has documented a comparison of Langfuse and OpenTelemetry capabilities for generative AI observability (e.g., trace collection, metadata tagging, latency metrics, and cost considerations). -When integration points are identified, the engineer has outlined a proposed architecture and integration plan for using one or both tools with AWS Bedrock (covering agents, knowledge bases, and related AWS components). -When documentation is finalized, the findings and recommendations are published in confluence and linked to this JIRA story for reference.

Title: Add BDA Project Setup Template Python Script to Tenant Resources

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer, I want a Python script template for BDA project setup in Tenant Resources, so that tenants can quickly and consistently initialize Bedrock Data Automation projects with minimal manual setup.

Acceptance Criteria: -A reusable Python script template is created for BDA project setup. -Script is added to the Tenant Resources repository/notebook. -Script includes clear instructions and placeholders for tenant-specific configuration. -Validate that running the script initializes a BDA project correctly without errors.
BIP-27990 Add additional support for Bedrock Features (i.e., Bedrock Data Automation, Prompting)
